question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the code you generate is executable. Can you design a chronic disease management care platform that demonstrates real-time data analysis, primarily involving the monitoring of vital signs and medication for hypertension, hyperlipidemia, and hyperglycemia? Please display it using HTML.

checklist.title: Is the vital sign monitoring system fully implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the code accurately implements real-time monitoring displays for key vital signs (blood pressure, blood glucose, and cholesterol levels) using appropriate data visualization techniques and includes threshold alerts for abnormal values. Score 0 if the core monitoring components are missing, 5 if only basic static displays are implemented, and 10 if interactive, real-time monitoring with clinical thresholds is fully included.

checklist.title: Is the medication management system properly implemented?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes functionality for tracking medication adherence, dosage schedules, and refill reminders for hypertension, hyperlipidemia, and hyperglycemia medications. Evaluate if it handles medication conflicts, provides dosage calculators based on vital signs, and includes medication history. Deduct 5 points if medication tracking is only basic lists, 3 points if no adherence tracking exists. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the data analysis and trend visualization system well-designed?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the platform includes comprehensive data analysis tools that show trends over time using appropriate charts (line graphs, bar charts, etc.) for all three conditions. Check if interactive elements allow filtering by date ranges and correlation analysis between different metrics. Deduct 5 points if visualizations are static, 3 points if trend analysis is limited to single metrics without correlation capabilities. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is there a comprehensive care plan management system?
checklist.description: Assess whether the code implements personalized care plan creation, tracking, and adjustment features based on clinical guidelines for chronic disease management. Check for goal-setting tools, progress tracking, and automated care plan recommendations based on vital sign trends. Deduct 5 points if care plans are static, 3 points if there's no ability to track progress against goals. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as missing data points, out-of-range values, connection issues when fetching data, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should implement data validation, error boundaries, and graceful degradation. Give 10 points for comprehensive error handling, 5 points for basic error checks, and 0 points if no exception handling exists.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. AI-powered predictive analytics for health deterioration 2. Integration with wearable device data simulation 3. Virtual health coach with personalized recommendations 4. Gamification elements for treatment adherence). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar data displays (e.g., multiple charts showing the same information) 2. Function modules unrelated to chronic disease management 3. Excessive animations or visual effects that affect performance and distract from critical health information. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating data processing/visualization/user interaction layers), component reusability, and code organization. Deduct 5 points if global variables are overused or if there's no clear separation of concerns; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if there's no data validation or sanitization. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional healthcare design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the design follows clinical UI best practices: 1) Appropriate color scheme for healthcare (blue/green tones, clear warning colors for alerts) 2) Clear information hierarchy with critical data prominently displayed 3) Accessible design with readable fonts (minimum 16px for body text) and sufficient contrast ratios (4.5:1). Deduct 3 points for each accessibility violation, 5 points for using inappropriate colors that could cause misinterpretation of medical data, and 5 points for cluttered displays that obscure critical information. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction suitable for healthcare practitioners and patients?
checklist.description: Judge whether the interface provides appropriate interactions for both clinical and patient use: 1) Clear categorization of information by condition 2) Intuitive navigation between monitoring sections 3) Responsive design that works on both desktop and mobile devices for patient access. Deduct 5 points for interactions requiring multiple clicks to access critical data, 3 points for confusing navigation structures, and 5 points for interactions that don't consider varying levels of technical literacy. The full score is 10 points.
